inn1.comm: starts off with a wide outside off. Some movement away
on target now, some shape away, defended off the front foot
beats Bijoy for pace. Hits him on the thigh pad. 139ks
again hits the bat high. On a length outside off, Bijoy goes to defend, and is hit on the shoulder of the bat and a bit on the glove too
too full and too straight this time, 141ks, picked away for a single
lovely first ball to Tamim. Nearly a yorker. This dips at him and swings away a touch. Dug out in front of off
full and straight, middle and leg, defended by Tamim
on a length, on off, 135ks, no swing, defended off the outside half of the bat
short of a length, outside off, he runs it down to third man for a single
tucks him up with one in his ribs. Tamim thinks he can work this shortish delivery to leg, but is beaten by the extra bounce. He is hit
Zadran nearly falls over as he lets this one go. Fullish, into the pads, concedes a leg-bye
fullish, middle and leg, 13t5ks, angling towards off. Defended off the front foot
slightly short, Bijoy looks to pull, gets a bottom edge into his thigh pad. Not short enough to pull
on a length, middle and off, moving away with the angle, defended to cover
short of a length, pitches leg, angles towards off. Defended solidly
full, on off, right behind it, drives it strongly, but straight to cover
Tamim is off the mark as he tucks this away off the hip. Takes a couple to the right of long leg

Tamim feels confident enough to drive now as Hamid pitches up. Tamim moves half forward. That movement is enough because this is overpitched. And then he opens the face at the last moment to place it past cover

Afghanistan are not referring this. Oh what a big moment this could be. Afsar Zazai and Hamid go up immediately as Tamim gets too ambitious and drives away from the body. There is a clear sound but umpire Steve Davis hasn't given this. This is bowled at 145ks and has gone past the edge. Clear sound. Clear spike on the snicko. The whole team gets into a huddle, they are told 15 seconds are over, and they don't get their man. This was gone. Steve Davis has struck again
picked away off the pads, and they take two. There were three runs available here but Bangladesh satisfied with two
short of a length, hits the high part of the defensive bat
slightly short of a length, middle and off, left alone
oh that's a jaffa. Just kicks off from just short of a length. Bijoy can't do anything about this. He is lucky this has started outside off. On the body and he would have fended
short of a length, at the stumps, defended from within the crease

fuller now, and edgy cricket all around. Bijoy hits it to cover where despite a dive from Sami Shenwari there should have been a single. Tamim doesn't want it, though. And the throw is wide but the first slip has not moved behind the keeper to back the throw up. And they get the single
yorker, swinging too, but swings too much and concedes a leg-bye down the leg
lovely shot. Hamid overpitches, and Tamim drives him with an open face to pierce the cover field
on a length, middle and leg, not driving length, and Tamim defends it back to him
short of a length, middle and off, angling away, left alone
half-volley, driven down the ground, but Stanikzai saves three runs with a dive at mid-on
another Hamid over ends with an appeal. This one is ambitious, though. Swinging late, and seems to have taken the inside edge on the way to the pad
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
dug in short, Tamim sways away from it. This sails harmlessly away outside off
short of a length, gets good bounce towards the chest. Tamim is on his toes as he defends
looks to force this shortish ball away but there is no room for him to be able to place it well. Finds cover-point
short of a length, outside off, Tamim defends off the front foot
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg to end a maiden. Zadran has conceded just two runs in three overs
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
length ball, outside off, 136ks, left alone by Bijoy
slightly fuller, closer to off, Bijoy moves forward to defend it in copy-book fashion
too full and too straight this time. On the pads with long leg quite square is not the way to go. Clipped away for an easy four
hits the inside half of the bat as Bijoy moves forward to drive. Mid-on does the fielding
short of a length, outside off, Bijoy gets a stride in and then lets this through to Zazai
short of a length, middle and leg, defended in front of off
similar delivery, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
short, outside off, gentle pace, cut away, but straight to cover-point
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away straight of midwicket for a single. A yes and no during what is a simple straightforward single
looks to dab this shortish delivery to third man, but is beaten by the low bounce
short of a length, rising towards the chest, defended off the back foot
too full, too straight, clipped away off the toes for three runs
slightly short of a length, moving back in a touch, defended off the back foot
that's a poor shot. Looks to pull what is almost a length ball. Obviously beaten
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
on a length, outside off, no room, defended to short cover
fuller, into the pads, tucked away for a single to long leg
pulled off the front foot. Not much pace on this shortish delivery. Gets this right and places it through midwicket for four
nicely played as this length ball angles into the pads. Wristily places it wide of deep square
that's an ordinary delivery. Short, wide, and Bijoy cuts this in front of square for four
good comeback. On a length, outside off, draws a drive from Bijoy and then the ball holds its line. Lucky to not draw the edge
full, just outside off, watchfully played to mid-off
some movement away and left alone outside off
length ball on the pads, flicked to midwicket
on a length, on off, punched away to cover
full, on off, 129ks, defended solidly off the front foot
inside edge as he looks for the big drive after three dot balls. Just plays down the wrong line of a length ball that is angling towards off
more watchful this time as he defends a similar delivery to cover
another maiden as Tamim has hit this gentle half-volley straight to cover
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
too full and straight. Called a wide down the leg side
that's close as Tamim plays across the line of a full ball. It doesn't turn, misses the inside edge and hits him in front. No turn, though, and it would have missed leg
flighted, outside off, pushed to long-off for one
full and straight, defended to leg
flighted outside off, played with the turn, but straight to short midwicket
moves across to defend this full ball to short midwicket
wild shot by Tamim. He has faced a maiden from Mirwais and charges at him premeditatedly. Mirwais shortens the length, and beats him by a big distance
more wild batting. This time with the running. Hits this straight to cover and goes for a suicidal single. The fielder fails to hit the stumps, Tamim survives and gets an overthrow to boot
length ball, seams back in a touch, gets an inside edge onto the pad
shimmies down the wicket to work this length ball to leg for a single
full, just outside off, defended to point
on a length, no room, Tamim is forced to play a defensive shot
overpitched on middle and leg, gets a single to long-on
seam-up variation. Just like Ashwin bowled in the game against Pakistan. This comes in to the left-hand batsman. Dabbed away for a single
Bijoy plays for non-existent turn and gets an edge to short third man
angling into the pads, clipped away for a single
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
fired in to look to end the over with a dot. And he gets the dot
Ashraf continues to be accurate. Gives nothing away to Tamim who drives this length ball to mid-off
again on a length and on off, and again driven straight to mid-off. It's building

you could sense it. You could see a reckless shot was around the corner. Tamim opens the face to a length ball on off. Manages just an edge that Afsar Zazai takes diving to his left. He takes it one-handed, but in mid-air he gets it right hand around and nearly transfers it from left to right. The right hand has come around because the ball is slipping out. The right glove pushes it back into the left. This is top keeping. Afghanistan have taken their first World Cup wicket, and they have built dot by dot to it. Persistent accurate cricket from a team known to be mercurial and unpredictable. Moles and Nabi will be pleased
full, on off, defended to mid-off
full, on the pads, driven straight to mid-on
and we have a wicket-maiden with a push straight to mid-off
on a length, no turn, defended in front of off
quicker, fuller, straighter. Defended to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, hit straight to midwicket

nicely played. The quicker flatter ball, he gets some room outside off, and has late-cut this past point for four. This is flying away to the boundary, the fielder gives up the chase early, and draws Nabi's ire
flighted on middle and off. Defended
pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
another length ball pushed straight to cover

Ashraf has got another. Or has he? Bijoy is hit on the back leg. The only thing that could save Bijoy is the impact, and he has reviewed this after being given out. Length ball, seams in from outside off, beats his drive, hits him on the back pad. The replay comes back with "umpire's call" on impact. So the decision stays. Ashraf has two now: last 16 balls, no run, wickets of both the openers
length ball outside off, defended to cover
he has broken the maiden. First run off Ashraf in three overs. Just a touch too straight and Mahmud clips it into the leg side for a couple
full, on the pads, easy four for the taking but he has missed completely. Hit on the pad
short of a length, outside off, punched away to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, left alone
bouncer, too high, called a wide
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
full toss, straight, pushed to mid-on
on a length, outside off, defended with an open face

a length, just outside off, driven to cover. Nabi does a bit of showmanship by mock-throwing with the ball not in his hand. Sarkar wants to teach him a lesson and take the single but Mahmudullah is not alert
on a length, middle and off, defended with an open face
soft drive on a length ball outside off. Driven on the up, but can't beat cover
fuller, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
takes a bit of a risk to break the shackles. On the pads and he has whipped this wristily through midwicket. In the air but in the gap
short of a length, not too wide but dabbed away to third man for a single
drops this length ball towards point and rushes through for a quick single. Finally some intent from Bangladesh
bouncer this time, just outside off, Mahmud ducks under it
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
full, on off, pushed slightly wide of mid-on, and they take a single
length ball outside off, moves in a touch and hits the inside half of the bat
short of a length, angling in, nicely worked away towards deep midwicket. Poor lethargic chase by Nabi. Concedes a third run
full, around off, slight movement back in, defended to mid-on
plays around the front pad and across the line. Beaten but this is headed down leg
short of a length, around off, runs this down to third man for a single
full ball, a touch too straight, and wided down the leg side
clipped away off the toes for a couple. Ashraf losing his line and length. Seven overs an over too many?
short of a length, middle and off, worked to midwicket
on a length, on off, hits the high part of the bat as Mahmudullah defends
full, middle and off, no turn, hits the inside half of the defensive bat
slightly flatter, slightly shorter, worked to leg for a single
overpitched on middle and leg, driven to long-on for one

dangerous. If you have been watching Nabi, he is not turning the ball. Keeping that in mind, a dangerous shot to go back to a length ball and play for tunr. Keeps this out in front of off this time, but needs to watch out
slower in the air, on the pads, worked away for a single
length ball, on off, bunts it into the on side for a single
on a length, angling in, defended to leg
short of a length, stays a little low, Mahmud plays him to leg but can't beat midwicket
fuller, some movement back in from outside off, and Mahmud defends watchfully
moves across the line but Ashraf doesn't move off his line and length, defended to leg
more yes and no. Mahmud starts to stroll after hitting it straight to point. Sarkar feels obliged to go too. But then they realise there is no single, and make it back just in time
another maiden from Ashraf. A length ball stays low, and is kept out by Mahmud - 8-3-17-2 now for Ashraf
a rare loose ball. Ahmadi starts with a short ball, and Sarkar pulls him over midwicket for four
slower and fuller, still he stays back to cut. Nabi misfields at point, and allows a single through. "Come on Nabi," screams Afsar from behind the stumps
worked to square leg, this time Nabi fields well and hits the stumps direct at the non-striker's end. Mahmud is well in, and they take an overthrow
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
flat delivery, stays back to punch this to deep cover
flighted outside off, worked to leg, with the turn. Gets a single
short of a length, angling in, worked towards square leg for a single
Sarkar finally does what Ashraf's bowling has been crying out for. Gives him the charge, gets under a length ball, and lofts him over long-on for a six. And this is a big boundary down the ground
looks to work a length ball to leg, gets a leading edge past cover for one
Mahmud shimmies down too, but Ashraf stays short of a length, and draws a defensive shot

nicely driven wide of mid-off, Hamid gets to it with a dive, but lets it through under his leg. Should have been one. He has conceded three. Just a circumspect dive. That microsecond wasted results in the misfield
on the pads with the fine leg up. Nicely flicked away past that man for four. Seventeen in his first eight overs, Ashraf goes for 15 in the ninth
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended to point
short of a length, angling in, again, towards off, defended back to him
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length again, tucked away off the hip. Brings up the fifty for the partnership

Two sounds there. Given. Sarkar wants to review, but can't because Bijoy wasted the review. This is full and straight, Sarkar plays a big shot, he is hit plumb in front, and only an inside edge can save him. Wilson has given him out. Sarkar is helpless with no review left. Replays suggest this might be front pad onto the back and not bat onto the pad. Good decision by Joel Wilson
too full, too straight, and Shakib gets a soft initiation into this innings. Just clips it fine for four
full, on off, defended
driven down the ground, but a full-length dive from Sami Shenwari at short straight midwicket saves the run
appeal for lbw as this one hits him on the back leg while turning from outside off. Hits him outside the line, though
a touch too full, pushed down to long-on for one
flat and quick, makes room, punches it wide of cover for one
short of a length, takes it from outside off, gets a single to square leg
short of a length,. hits him high on the bat. Defended
appeal for lbw as this is full and straight, but it is swinging too much to miss the leg stump. Might just have been an inside edge too
sucker delivery. Thrown up wide and full. Draws a loose drive away from the body. Unlucky not to get the edge
short of a length, angling in, dropped into the on side for an easy single
full, nearly a yorker, he has dug it out for a single. No dot for Shakib yet
another yorker to end the over. A dot as he digs this out to cover
Shakib showing a clear difference in class over the other. These are the balls other have been patting away for dots. He goes back and punches a length ball wide of deep cover for two
first dot for Shakib as he defends a fullish ball back to him
flatter and shorter, punched down to long-on
tries the sweep from outside off. Misses, is hit on the forearm
sharp turn, goes softly towards square leg. Shakib is quick but Mahmud is slow. Afsar wants the fielder Nabi to go to the bowler's end but he doesn't. Shakib has made it easily
too short, pulled away over midwicket for four. Shakib has injected urgency into this innings

Zadran has taken another wicket. Another lovely catch from Afsar Zazai. A length ball angling in, Mahludullah looks to defend, the extra bounce draws the edge, which is dying to the right of Afsar but he gets both his hands to it and takes it inches off the ground
low full toss, pushed back to him
bounces Mushfiq who ducks under it. Called one bouncer for the over
full, on the pads, clipped away off the toes for a couple
drives a length ball on the up, gets a single to deep point
short of a length, angling in, hits the bat high
lovely ball first up. Nice flight and dip. Some drift too. Defended back to him. Played in front of middle and leg
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
full, straight and fast, Shakib looks to use the pace but can't beat short fine leg
drops this one short, Shakib gets a fair bit of bat on the cut, but can't beat cover
flighted on middle and leg, gets some dip too, hit straight to short midwicket
stays low as Shakib looks to cut a shortish delivery. Lucky to not edge it
length ball angling in towards top of off. Defended from the crease
full and swinging in, driven, but straight to short cover
yorker, just outside off, dug out straight to mid-off
good shot. Just short of being a yorker. A half-volley then. Mushfiq gets his front foot forward, and opens the face at the last moment to beat the fielder at point
dug in short, runs it down to third man for a single
short, into the hip, he flick-pulls it to fine leg for a single
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
long hop nearly gets him a wicket. Pulled on the bounce to deep midwicket
short of a length, goes deep to punch it wide of cover for a single
tossed up, pushed from outside off to long-on for one
goes back to cut but there is no room, and he can't place it either side of point
goes back to cut again but the ball is not that short, and the extra bounce beats him top edge
starts with a wide down the leg side. Just angling too far
short of a length, cut away to deep cover
full, into the pads from round the wicket, pushed to midwicket
yorker, too straight, though, and concedes a leg-bye
full outside off, driven to deep cover
full down the leg side, called a wide
yorker, on off stumps, played with an open face to point
short of a length, Shakib looks to pull, but this is not short enough. Hit on the thigh pad
tossed up, but too straight. No room. Defended to midwicket
gets away with it. Short and wide. Asking to be cut away for four. Mushfiq cuts, but can't beat point
chips a slog sweep between long-on and deep midwicket. Gets a couple
nice shot. Shimmies down the wicket. Gets to the pitch of the ball. Chips it over cover. Inside-out. Four
length ball, on off, worked to leg for one
tossed up outside off, driven to deep cover for another single
nearly bowled him first ball. Gets a big inside edge on the big drive. Goes past short fine for three
on a length, angling in, towards top of off. Mushfiq defends
well played Mushfiq. He begins to give him the charge, Hamid goes short, and Rahim changes the shot to ramp him over the keeper
slogs him away. That is a length ball, and he gets under it to drop him over midwicket for four
dipping low full toss. It has beaten the bat but is headed down leg. A leg-bye conceded
short and wide, cut away, but can't beat point
length ball, on off, driven straight of long-on for a couple
short of a length, on off, played with an open face to point
full toss, dips on him, mis-times the swat. Gets a couple
yorker outside off, dug out into the covers for one
dug out to cover, and Mushfiq refuses what should have been a single because short cover charges towards the ball even though he doesn't field it
misses the line and length only marginally. Just a bit short of a yorker, just a bit too straight. Clipped away off the toe, wide of short fine leg it goes
looks to ramp this over short fine, toe-ends it to midwicket for one
bowls from wide on the crease, stays full, but Shakib drives with an open face, past cover. Fifty for this partnership
half-volley outside off, and he has driven him between mid-off and cover for four. All along the ground
straying onto the pads, and is picked away into the leg side
low full toss, hit straight to midwicket. Rare dot
slower ball, beats his flicks, concedes a leg-bye
makes room to hit this low full toss firmly to Zadran at mid-off. Zadran misses with the throw. Shakib is gone if he hits. He survives
slower ball, flicked down to long-on for one
full and straight, Shakib makes room and drives this straight of mid-on. This is turning out to be a c rucial partnership
low full toss outside off, Shakib makes room and crashes him past cover for four more. Bangladesh running away with it now
gets the yorker right this time, gets a dot in
slower ball, on a length, driven down to long-on for one
quick ball into the pads, driven wide of long-on for two
makes room to drive another flat delivery down the ground but gets only the single to long-on this time
slows this one down, gets some dip on it, driven to long-on for one
makes room to drive this from outside leg to wide of long-off for a couple
flighted, much slower than the previous ball, Shakib has to wait before chipping this over Nabi's head, and straight of long-off. Gets a couple
quicker ball outside off, hits Shakib's toe end for a dot
on a length, close to off, Rahim runs it down to third man for a single
short of a length, no room, but Shakib back away to dab this to third man for one

appeal for lbw as this cuts back in from a length and outside off. Given not out because bat is close to the pad and is involved, but the replays show it has hit the pad first. Once again Afghanistan has not reviewed it. Showing some inexperience. Davis strikes again, although it is hard to tell with the bat and pad so close together
and now it hurts them more. Length ball, gentle pace, and he has picked it up effortlessly off the toes for a six square on the leg side
slower ball, short and wide, cut away to deep point
full, outside off, driven back to the bowler
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
slow in the air, dips on him, no room, defended by Rahim
full and wide, driven wide of long-off for a couple that brings up his fifty. This innings could be the turning point in this match
dips on him, flicked to midwicket
Nawroz mangal overthrows from short third man. Easy single given away. Aghanistan need to tighten up
full, on the pads, clipped away to long leg
on a length, angling in, tucked away into the leg side to bring up his fifty. Bangladesh's best cricketer of all time rescuing them again
looks for the ramp over fine leg by moving well across outside the off, but has his inside edge beaten
slogs at a length ball, gets a thick inside edge for a single. Nawroz Mangal attacks the ball out in the deep and keeps them down to one
short of a length, cut away to deep cover for one
yorker, damn good yorker, right on the popping crease. Shakib is alert, and calls him through for a single
catches him back away and slips in a wide full delivery that is out of his reach. Smart bowling there. Gets in a valuable dot
length-ball offbreak, Rahim opens the face to get a single to short third man
yorker, Shakib can't do much with it, the ball goes back to Nabi, but Rahim's bat is in the way, and they take a single off the ricochet
driven to long-on for one
slower, much slower, Shakib has to wait and wait, and gets only a single to long-off
slightly shorter offbreak, Rahim goes back, makes room, and cuts this in front of square even though he has made contact outside leg. Top shot
full, straight and quick, played into a gap on the on side, and comes back for a couple
full toss. Yorker gone wrong. Shakib slugs it. Gets enough bat on it to beat mid-off and get a four
digs this one in short, Shakib pulls, doesn't get all of it, but the top edge is massive and sails over deep square leg for a six. Not a clever ball with no fielder back there
wide yorker, he tries to steer it, but can't beat point

slower ball, and he has bowled him finally. Afghanistan needed this to put the brakes on. Shakib is early into this slog over midwicket, and gets an inside edge onto the stumps. This is delivered wide of the crease, and they are checking for a no-ball. Both his front and back foot are well in. Shakib has to go back. Inside edge onto the pad, and then a trickle into the base of off
low full toss first up, and hit straight to cover
length ball with no room. Another dot. Four of them after the first two balls went for 10. Good comeback by Hamid
full toss, driven to long-on for one
slow offbreak, turned to square leg for a single. The single is all down to Rahim's early call and aggressive running
low full toss, driven to long-off for one
another flat full toss, pushed to deep midwicket for one
on a length, middle and leg, pushed into the on side for another single
wide full toss, square-driven, with no deep point in place. This has all the makings of ruining a good over, but Nawroz Mangal's dive at point saves the boundary
slogs this length ball, gets a thick inside edge, will get just the single. Last 11 balls: only six runs
slower ball, picks it off the pitch, takes the single into the leg side
Hamid bowls the slower ball, Rahim opens the face, gets the single to short third
wide on the crease, an effort ball, short of a length, the extra bounce beats his attempt to cut

Hamid Hasan has another wicket. Wide on the crease again, gets that sharp movement back in, Shabbir looks to make room, and is cramped. He chops it on. Hamid pulls out the Brett Lee-style chainsaw celebration
on a length, dropped to leg for a single. Another good over for Afghanistan. Only nine runs off the last 16 balls. Two wickets to boot
seam-up delivery from Nabi. It's a yorker. Mortaza gets enough bat on it to take a single
improvisation from Rahim. He moves across, takes this on the full, and uses Nabi's pace to lap this fine of short fine leg

high full toss but not high enough to be called a no-ball even despite the smallness of Rahim. The ball gets too close to him, and he can neither hit it for six nor keep it down. Sami Shenwari charges in from deep midwicket and takes a good catch low to his right. But has Rahim already done the damage with a superb innings?
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
full toss outside off, Mortaza makes room and accepts this gift with glee. Gets it over cover for four
drags this ball short, and Mortaza bats smartly to send this crashing for four. No sweeper on the off side. You can't bowl this. Mortaza makes room and cuts him
full ball hit to cover, where a misfield allows them to come through for one. The throw from mid-off is a little high, and by the time Afsar drags it down, Mortaza has made it to the striker's end
Mortaza is playing a little gem here. A length ball, just outside off, and he has pierced the gap between mid-off and cover
looks to slog this into the leg side, is beaten, and takes a leg-bye
slower ball, Haque wants to scoop this, is beaten by pace, gets just the single to short fine leg
yorker, dug out to short straight midwicket. A dot ball in

slower short ball, Mortaza is beaten on the slog, calls Haque through for a bye because he wants to retain strike, but Afsar Zazai hits the stumps with the underarm flick and Haque has no chance of making it
Length ball, quick, Mortaza slogs, is beaten by the pace, and is beaten. That's one ball you are asked to not bowl at the death, but he has got the wicket with it
low full toss from round the wicket, gets a single to deep cover
short of a length, angling in, hits him on the pad. Robel late into the shot. Another dot

another swing and a miss. There is a sound as the ball passes the inside edge. Only Afzar Zazai is appealing. They sneak in a bye, but Nabi is not reviewing it again. There is a sound but that is bat hitting the pad
yorker, beats the inside edge, Zazai fumbles the take, and they take two byes to short third man because the ball has travelled softly towards the man
bowled him. Bangladesh bowled out off the last ball of the innings. Taksin goes for the big hit, Alam is full and straight, and he has pinged back the off stump

inn2.comm: short and wide first up, cut away to third man for one
fuller, angling in, punched to midwicket
short of a length, wide, Zazai plays a vertical-bat shot to it and is beaten. Not a cut not a drive. Half and half. Not the best way to go
short of a length, widish, Zazai leaves this alone
thick edge to a wide length ball, gets a single to third man

and Bangladesh have struck in the first over. Short of a length, sits up a little and Ahmadi is early into the the shot. He is looking to work it to leg, but manages a big leading edge that lobs up for an easy catch for Mortaza who runs towards cover to claim it

another wicket. This is a great start for Bangladesh. Short of a length, outside off, angles in Zazai caught on the hop. The ball skids through to hit him in front of off. Or is it in front of off? Given out by Davis. The two batsmen discuss the review, but decide against it. Seems like umpire's call on the impact with regards to off stump and also with regards to the height
full and wide, swinging away, squeezes this yorker between keeper and slip
short of a length, good bounce, Mangal gets behind the ball and defends
moves across to cover the line of the ball and leaves this alone
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, he moves across to get behind it an defend
on a length, angling in towards off, defended from the crease
full, on off, defended to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
on a length, outside off, defended from the crease
stays back to defend a full ball to mid-on

Bangladesh are running through Afghanistan here. Nervous batting from them here. Wide length ball here, Stanikzai's feet don't move and he throws his hands in a nothing shot well away from his body. Mahmudullah fumbles at first slip, but he doesn't drop it
short of a length, quick, 145ks, Mangal looks to whip this to leg, hit on the thigh. They appeal for a bat-pad catch. No bat involved, though
he has missed out on the short and wide delivery. No feet in the cut. Beaten
moves across to try to pull this shortish delivery, and is beaten by the lack of the bounce. Trying to manufacture a shot
short of a length, outside off, runs it wide of point for a single
short of a length, wide, left alone
length ball, into the pads, worked away past midwicket. And Afghanistan have seen off one over without a wicket
good outswinger from wide on the crease. He looks to drive it down the ground but is beaten by the movement
moves across to defend a length ball outside off
short of a length, widish, runs this down to third man
short of a length, wide, left alone
outside edge as Sami goes forward to defend. Soft edge, though, and he gets a single
moves across to defend a length ball, gets a soft leading edge
short of a length, outside off, punched past point
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
slightly fuller, he moves forward to defend
bouncer, he gets inside it, and under it
tucked away off the hip for two
good ball. Slightly short of driving length, outside off, and then it seams away against the angle. Beats the bat
this one comes in with the angle, and he is right behind it in defence
well bowled again. Just holding its line after pitching. And it's not full enough to be reaching the pitch of it to cover the movement. Beaten again
this is slightly wide, and is left alone without trouble
short of a length, outside off, he covers the line and defends
drives at a wide length ball, gets a thick edge that avoids second slip and gets him a single
full, just outside off, defended from the crease
slightly short of a length, holds its line outside off, left alone
short of a length, wide, dabbed away to deep point for one
full, some swing outside off, defended form the crease. Bowled at 142ks
bouncer, gets under it, but called a wide for height
short of a length, widish, punched away between point and cover-point for a couple
wide length ball, and he has driven it square. There is a deep point in place to keep them down to one
short of a length, angling in, he is right behind it in defence
length ball, angling in, pushed to midwicket, an unnecessary direct hit concedes an overthrow
missed out. Short and wide. That should be put away. But he makes no connection with the cut
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge as he plays from the crease
short and wide again. He has missed out on two boundary balls here. Beaten on the cut again
length ball, angling in, defended to midwicket. Tasking lucky in this over that he didn't concede two boundaries on the square cut
this one moves in sharply, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg
wide length ball, timed well, but straight to point
wide length ball, he doesn't move his feet but he throws his hands at it, and gets enough bat on it to hit this over cover for the first boundary of the innings
short of a length, angling in from wide on the crease. Defended off the back foot
full, close to off, driven down the ground, but can't beat mid-off
short of a length, widish, pushed wide of cover for a single
bouncer, but too short. Easy to duck under. Not called a wide, though
short of a length, close to off, punched away to cover
fuller, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
on a length, just outside off, and pushed back to mid-off again
plays the upper cut that nearly carries all the way to the square third man
short of a length, outside off, left alone
god sharp bouncer. He ducks under it. Called one for the over
full, just outside off, driven back at Mortaza
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
pitched up, driven hard, but straight to mid-off
good short ball, gets big from just short of a length, and he has to jump in the air to keep this down
another four ball left unpunished. This is short and wide, but he doesn't get close enough it while cutting, and is beaten
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats his outside edge
slightly short, driven on the up, gets a single to deep cover
good bouncer, hits him on the helmet, lobs it towards short fine. Stays up there for a long time. Rahim tries to reach it, but can't make it. Called a run. So there must be an edge involved too
short and wide, just a touch slow, cut away to deep cover
nice punch shot to a shortish ball, gets a single to deep cover
full on middle and leg, worked away for a single
tossed up just outside off, doesn't turn, hits the inside half of the bat
full, middle and leg, hit to short and straight midwicket
laps this from in front of the stumps and gets a couple
tossed up outside off, driven to the right of deep cover for a couple
fired in this time, punched away to deep square for one
length ball, outside off, pushed past cover for one
short of a length, wide, nicely punched away to deep cover
pulled away emphatically. Finally Taskin's ordinary bowling has been punished. He has been bowling short and wide and been getting away with it, but this time Shenwari pulls him through midwicket

Shakib has dropped him. This upper-cut is not the best option with the third man square. He has come close to getting out earlier, too, but this time it carries to Shakib who is running forward. He takes the catch but the ball pops out when the elbows hit the ground
stays back to defend a length ball
short, wide, but there is good bounce behind it, and he has left it alone
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
slower through the air, there is some turn, and he defends with an open face
flatter, into the pads, defended to leg
slows it down this time, pushed to cover
flat and fuller, pushed to long-off for one
nicely tossed up around off, defended from the crease
offbreak on target, defended back to Mahmud
length ball, flat, worked to leg for one
leading edge as this is pushed into the pads. Gets a single to long-on
full and flat, pushed down to long-on for one
overpitched but short straight midwicket Sarkar saves a single with a dive
short of a length, worked away for an easy single to leg
slightly short, cut away to deep cover for one
short of a length again, but defended off the back foot this time
flighted around off, played back to him
pushed into the pads, but he can't beat midwicket
gets a thick inside edge as he looks to defend a full ball
short of a length, punched to long-off for one
tossed up, turning in towards leg, defended back to him
tossed up outside off, driven against the turn, but can't beast extra cover in the circle
flatter, punched away for a single to long-on
into the pads again, and worked away for an easy single
flat and quick, defended back to Mahmudullah
swept away from in front of the stumps, makes good connection, gets a single to deep square leg
short of a length, punched away to deep cover
driven on the up, wide of deep cover for two
cut away to cover, they go for a single, the throw is quick, but they get two overthrows off the ricochet off the stumps
wide length ball, driven away to deep cover for one
short of a length, wide, late-cut away to the right of third man for a couple
length ball outside off, pushes it on the run and gets a single to deep cover
takes a sharp legbye as this rolls towards square leg
short of a length, punched away, but can't beat cover-point
flighted around off, defended from the crease
length ball outside off, played with the turn, but straight to short third man
down the wicket to drive this but still finds midwicket
slightly short, he goes back to cut, but the ball stays low to defeat his shot. A maiden over
slow in the air, on middle and leg, defended back
flatter, into the pads, misses out. Hit on the pad
flat length ball, driven to deep cover for one
flighted, middle and off, defended to leg
own the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, pushes to midwicket
tossed up again, driven straight to mid-on
flighted around middle and off, defended to short straight midwicket
driven hard but finds extra cover
slightly short and he has pulled this to deep midwicket for one

big catch from Rubel but he is not coming up after going down. This is swept hard. Timed it. Rubel has to rush back at deep square leg. The amount of timing has surprised him. He takes it head high, but the backward momentum takes him down. He doesn't come up. Seems to have hurt his calf. Gets attention from the medical staff
flighted on off, defended
another forward defensive to end the over
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, wide, punched away to third man
length ball, on off, pushed to cover
another push off the back foot, straight to cover
finds the gap with that back-foot push this time, gets a single to deep cover
not in control of the pull, the top edge falls well short of deep square
pushed off the back foot to long-on for one
flat, on the pads, worked away towards deep square
sharp turn as he plays back to a fullish ball. Hit on the pad but it is headed down
fuller, flatter, straighter, easy single taken
swept away from middle and leg, gets a single to deep square
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
slugs a length ball. Not in control of it at all but it runs off the inside half of the bat and over mid-on. First boundary in 10 overs
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover

tucked away off the hip, and this is superb fielding from Bangladesh. This is not straight to fine leg and this is a big playing field so they go for the second but the throw from Shabbir - even though he is falling - is spot on and quick. Rahim collects it in front of the stumps to save that half a second and pulls this onto the stumps. Shenwari's dive is not good enough to save the wicket
length ball angling across him and he is beaten as he pushes at it
a length ball around off, defended with an open face
this one turns sharply from middle and leg, and is called a wide
flighted outside off, defended back to him
flat, shortish, punched down to long-off for one
flighted on middle and leg, defended back to him
flighted on middle and off, slow through the air, played back to him
sweeps this from in front of off, beats short fine leg, gets four for it
short and wide, cut away, gets a single to deep cover
gets away with a long hop, pulls this to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
another short ball, and finds deep midwicket with this pull. Gets a couple
quicker and fuller, defended back to him
nicely tossed up on middle and off, defended back again
another forward defensive to end the over
flatter, into the pads, defended to leg
full, into the pads, worked away for a single
flat, just outside off, cut away, but can't beat cover-point
flighted around off, pushed back to him
short and wide, cut away to deep cover
lovely shot. This is flighted outside off, is too full, and he drives this hard with an open face. Hurtles along the ground to the point boundary
length ball, middle and off, played back to Sarkar
full outside off, driven hard with an open face, but can't beat point
slower ball, middle and leg, turns towards the off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, middle and off, opens the face, can't beat point
tucked away off the pads for a single
short and wide, he reaches out to cut, but is beaten
slightly short, cut away straight to deep cover
lap sweeps this full ball from around off, gets three runs to fine leg
tossed up outside off, mis-times a drive to cover
into the pads, worked away for a single
flighted well outside off, he pushes it to cover
flatter, goes back to push this down to long-on for one
makes room, creates a bit too much distance between him and this low full toss outside off. Hits it straight to mid-off
full, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
full and straight, slightly slower, defended to cover
full, on the pads, flicked away for a single
yorker, dips on him, just outside off, can't do much with that
not in control of this pull at all but the top edge falls short and wide of deep square leg
looks to make room, Hossain pitches short, Nabi swings, gets an edge to third man for a couple
short again, stays low, pulled away for a single to deep square
short of a length, wide, beats the punch with the angle
square-driven hard, to the left of third man, gets a couple
quick length ball, lets out a grunt as he releases. At 143ks it goes. Defended back to him
bouncer, middle and leg, quite sharp too, at 139ks, he ducks under it
flat start, goes back to punch this to deep midwicket
short of a length, outside off, pushed between point and cover for one
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, hit on the pad, but the ball is headed down leg
that's a loose delivery. Full and outside leg with short fine leg up. And he has helped it along for four with a sweep
flighted on middle and off, defended from the crease
leaves the crease again, muscles this, but it goes off the inside half of the bat for a single
short, he makes room and pulls this over midwicket. Gets four for it
back-to-back boundaries. Is there some fight left in the match yet? Too full and too straight, and he glances this fine for four
short of a length, angling towards top of off. He defends it with an open face
fuller, angling in, played with an open face, gets a single
looks to swipe at this length ball, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
slower ball, middle and off, played with an open face. Doesn't get a single because the fielder at point is alert
makes room to try and hit through covers, creates too much distance between himself and the ball. Beaten
on a length, just outside off, Nabi plays with soft hands but doesn't get a single. No gap at cover
Nabi charges at Mortaza, gets under a length ball, and drives it over cover for four
slower ball, full, driven, but straight to the man at cover
short of a length, bunted into the on side for one
on a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended with an open face
short of a length, punched between long-on and deep midwicket
another punch down the ground but straight to long-on
sweeps from middle stump, but can't beat short fine leg
tossed up around off, no room, defended back to him
flighted outside off, pushed to cover for a single

flighted outside off, dips on him, turns him, beats him all ends up, given out lbw but he has reviewed it. The ball is turning a lot, but Najib thinks he has got outside the line of off. Oh boy. The impact seems outside off, but the hawkeye has returned an umpire's call. I don't think there was more than a hair's breadth worth of ball inside the line when it hit the pad. It stays with the on-field call
and this is unravelling fast bow. Length ball outside off, looks to hit hard, doesn't get all of it, and mid-off takes an easy catch. Too much pressure of asking rate with hardly any wickets in hand
stays back to defend a length ball to mid-on
swings his bat hard at a full ball after clearing the front leg. Gets is over extra cover for four
bouncer in response to that boundary. He ducks under it
throws his bat at a short ball, is beaten by the bounce
slower ball outside off, defended form the crease
tossed up around off, some turn away, defended from the crease
flat, into the pads, defended to midwicket
solid front-foot defensive to a flighted delivery
length ball, middle and off, pushed to long-off
front-foot defensive as Sahkib slows this down
down the wicket to smash this over the bowler's head for four
short of a length, punched back to him
short of a length, outside off, punched down the ground to mid-off
another punch from the back foot but the ball is going nowhere
absolute action-replay of the first three deliveries
down the track and swipes across the line to get a single
slower-ball full toss, he gives up plans to go over mid-off and defends
sweeps this from in front of the stumps, gets a couple
flat delivery, beats the inside edge, going down
flighted outside off, defended to cover

he has thrown his hands at this full ball. Sweeps without getting all the way down to his knee. Makes a good enough connection beat Tamim Iqbal at deep midwicket. Tamim was well inside the boundary. Had he been at the edge, he would have taken this
defended off the front foot
another big hit as Shakib tosses this wide outside off. This is clever bowling. Tailenders just go after them. No timing on this. Caught at long-off
full, straight, played to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, left alone after exposing the stumps
moves away from the stumps again, hangs his bat up somewhere and the short ball comes and hits it
moves away to leave another widish ball alone
swings hard at a length ball outside off, gets a thick edge that lobs up to point. One more wicket to go
full and outside off, the edge goes wide of slip. He survives
short and flat, pulled away for a single
flat length ball, defended off the front foot
tossed up, he is drawn out of the crease, takes it on the half-volley and edges it to point
that's a big six. This is a big straight boundary, and he jumps out of the crease to loft this dead straight for a six

a run-out to end the match. The fervour with which Mushfiqur has broken the wicket shows how much it means to Bangladesh. A lot of confusion after the dive at cover-point. No time for Aftab to get back. I am surprised Mushfiq is not injured after violently breaking the wicket. A lot of anger on his face too
